sections.paragraphs:
{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2013}}
[[File:Strykjärnet Motala ström Norrköping april 2005.jpg|thumb|200px|''Styrkjärn'' in central Norrköping]]

The '''Museum of Work''' (''Arbetetsmuseum'') is a museum located in [[Norrköping]], Sweden. The museum is located in the ''Styrkjärn'', a former weaving mill in the old industrial area on the [[Motala ström]] river in the city centre of Norrköping. The former textile factory  Holmens Bruks och Fabriks  operated in the building from 1917-1962.<ref>{{cite web|url=    https://www.nt.se/nyheter/norrkoping/nu-fyller-det-klassiska-huset-100-ar-om4863406.aspx|title =  Norrköping Strykjärnet   |website=  nt.se     |access-date=1 December 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=    https://www.guidebook-sweden.com/en/guidebook/destination/arbetets-museum-museum-work-norrkoeping|title =   Arbetets Museum
|website= guidebook-sweden.com   |access-date=1 December 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.loc.gov/item/2012646896/|title =   Holmens bruks och fabriks|website=   loc.gov|access-date=1 December 2019}}</ref>

The museum documents work and everyday life by collecting personal stories about people's professional lives from both the past and the present.   The museum's archive contain material from memory collections and documentation projects.<ref>{{cite web|url= https://upplev.norrkoping.se/en/item/arbetets-museum    
|title =   The Museum of Work (Arbetets museum)|website= norrkoping.se   |access-date=1 December 2019}}</ref>

Since 2009, the museum also houses the EWK - Center for Political Illustration Art, which is based on work of the satirist [[Ewert Karlsson]] (1918–2004). For decades he was frequently published in the Swedish tabloid, ''[[Aftonbladet]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=  https://pagefiddler.wordpress.com/2014/05/20/ewk-ewert-karlsson-great-figures-of-the-world/ |title =   Ewert Karlsson 
|website= wordpress.com|access-date=1 December 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.artsignaturedictionary.com/artist/ewert.karlsson       
|title =   Ewert   Karlsson (1918–2004) also known as: EWK|website=  artsignaturedictionary.com|access-date=1 December 2019}}</ref>
